security: Revealing contact with a source providing information on anti-Castro groups could expose the source and compromise ongoing intelligence operations. Quoting the document: '...represent to us the ambitions, operations and proposed sabotage activities of Alpha-66 so that they can either be controlled, encouraged or discouraged...' This reveals an intention to possibly manipulate the Cuban action group, which could cause diplomatic issues if exposed.
summary: The New York Office reports contact with Robert A. Pratchett, a US citizen with extensive Cuban experience, who is in contact with the anti-Castro group Alpha-66 and offers to provide detailed information about their operations and sabotage activities for potential control or influence.
summary_one_paragraph: On August 31, 1962, the Chief of the New York Office sent a memorandum to the Chief of the Contact Division, Support Branch, regarding Robert A. Pratchett, a new US citizen source with 27 years of Cuban experience. Pratchett is in direct contact with the Cuban counterrevolutionary group Alpha-66 and anti-Castro Cubans in Havana, offering to provide detailed insights into Alpha-66's ambitions, operations, and proposed sabotage activities, including plans to blow up all the power plants in Cuba, for the US Government's consideration in controlling, encouraging, or discouraging their actions; Pratchett is willing to assist in a non-pay status due to his extensive knowledge of Cubans, Cuba, and the Spanish language.
title: Robert Pratchett Cuban Counterrevolutionary Group, Alpha-66
persons_mentioned: AJAY JAY B. B. L. REEVES
